result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron T Franson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, if not fully engaged, GFE to obtain status AND 10 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete SAFE intake program and follow up.  Treatment, counseling, assessment as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA.  DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron T Franson

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
and Reimbursement to County - signed 5/11/16
includes 15CF539 & 15CF856

Clerk Charli
Case Called: 2:11 p.m.
INCLUDES: 15CF539, 15CF856, 15TR3532
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Def appears in person with Atty Rick Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to:
15CF539
Ct. 2 (Operating w/PAC- 5th)>> DIMISSED
15CF856
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>> DRI
Ct. 3 (Disorderly Conduct-DA)>> DRI
15TR3532
Ct. 1 (Refuse to Take Test for Intoxication)>> DEEMED LAWFUL
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
15CF539
Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>> Guilty
15CF856
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property-DA)>> Guilty

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF539 Ct. 1- S/H 3 years probation, I/S 6 years prison (3 IC & 3 ES); CONDITIONS: $600 fine + CC; AODA Assessment, DNA Sample and Surcharge; 1 year MCJ with huber for work/treatment/NA/AA if eligible, with I/S 6 mos for rule Violation, remaining 6 months must commence within 45 days; 3 years DL revocation;  Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 3 years; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation; Absolute Sobriety; Comply with all rules/terms/conditions of OWI Court.

15CF856 Ct. 2- S/H 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE INTAKE Program and Follow Up; Treatment/Counseling/Assessment as deemed appropriate by agent; AODA; Absolute Sobriety; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination of the 2, if not fully engage, GTE to obtain status AND 10 hours CS per week; DA Surcharge; DNA Sample and Surcharge. 

COURT ORDERS BOND to be returned to SY;
COURT notes all Counts sentenced today to run concurrent; 
COURT notes 2 days credit in 15CF539
COURT notes Deft is eligible for SAP ONLY.

Adj: 2:27 p.m.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15TR3532, 15CF856, 15CF539 Called: 10:55am
State appears by ADAs S.Brubacher and M.Puerner (on 15CF856 only); Deft appears in person with Atty Rick Cveykus
Waiver of Prelim. filed in 15CF856

15CF856>> 
Court questions deft as to waiver of prelim in 15CF856
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY
Bond:  Continued
Dates to be set on all cases - STC w/JA in approx 2 weeks on all cases.

15TR3532 and 15CF539>>
Atty Cveykus states refusal hearing is still pending; Atty Brubacher states no refusal hearing requested -  State reserves right to revisit refusal issue at any time.
Bond continues.

Adj: 10:59am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:33 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time set for preliminary hearing. 
Deft makes statement - states Atty Rick Cveykus was appointed at an indigency hearing in another matter. 
COURT appoints Atty Rick Cveykus to represent the deft in this case with fee cap of $750 in this file without further order of the court. 
COURT notes monthly payment will reman the same as in the other file and will also cover this file. 
Deft tolls time limits for preliminary hearing. 
COURT accepts tolling of time limits. 
State notes PTC is set in Br. 4 for 10/13/2015 at 2:30pm in Br. 4 at which time preliminary hearing can be set. 
Adj: 9:38 am 

cc: Br. 4

No contact with victim(s):  R.F.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
